warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind back and gently straighten arms, hold for 30 seconds. Then, interlock fingers behind head and gently pull elbows back, hold for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, placing hand behind the head. Use the other hand to gently push the elbow further back, hold for 30 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading legs and raising arms overhead. Return to starting position.
Perform light cardio such as jogging in place or jumping jacks for 1 minute to increase heart rate and blood flow.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported.  Grab the handles with a slightly wider than shoulder-width grip. Ensure your feet are flat on the floor.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the machine with your back firmly against the backrest. Grab the handles, ensuring a secure grip.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the handles away from your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Descent: Slowly bring the handles back towards your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your pectoral muscles. Avoid letting the weight slam against your chest.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bringing the handles close to your chest at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, with an overhand grip. Lower the bar to your chest.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the bar away from your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Descent: Slowly lower the bar back to your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your pectoral muscles. Avoid letting the weight slam against your chest.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bringing the bar close to your chest at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on controlled movements and a full range of motion.  Engage your core to stabilize your body.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, positioned just above your chest.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the dumbbells upwards. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Descent: Slowly lower the dumbbells back to your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your pectoral muscles. Avoid letting the weight slam against your chest.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bringing the dumbbells close to your chest at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a height that allows you to sit comfortably. Sit on the seat and grab the handles.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit comfortably on the seat with your back straight. Grab the handles, ensuring a secure grip.
2. The Fly: Extend your arms outwards, feeling a stretch in your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly bring the handles back together, feeling a contraction in your pectoral muscles.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the sides and bringing the handles together in front of your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Sit on the cable fly machine, ensuring your back is straight and supported. Adjust the seat height if necessary. Grab the handles with a comfortable grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Grab the handles, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. The Fly: Extend your arms outwards, feeling a stretch in your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly bring the handles back together, feeling a contraction in your pectoral muscles.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the sides and bringing the handles together in front of your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
2. The Fly: Extend your arms outwards, feeling a stretch in your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly bring the dumbbells back together, feeling a contraction in your pectoral muscles.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the sides and bringing the dumbbells together in front of your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 12 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on the mind-muscle connection, feeling the stretch and contraction in your chest muscles.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with your arms fully extended overhead, holding the bar attachment with an overhand grip.
2. The Extension: Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows, lowering the bar behind your head. Focus on controlled movement.
3. Full Extension: Extend your elbows fully, returning to the starting position. Maintain tension on the cable throughout the movement.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bending your elbows fully at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width. Extend your arms fully, holding the bar straight above your chest.
2. The Crush: Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows, lowering the bar towards your forehead. Focus on controlled movement.
3. Full Extension: Extend your elbows fully, returning to the starting position. Maintain tension on the bar throughout the movement.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bending your elbows fully at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, narrow grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width).
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a close, narrow grip (slightly narrower than shoulder-width). Lower the bar to your chest.
2. The Press: Extend your arms fully, pushing the bar away from your chest. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Descent: Slowly lower the bar back to your chest, feeling a deep stretch in your triceps muscles. Avoid letting the weight slam against your chest.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the top and bringing the bar close to your chest at the bottom.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to the cable machine's low pulley. Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Grip the straight bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
2. The Press Down: Extend your arms fully, pushing the bar downwards. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return the bar to the starting position, feeling a stretch in your triceps muscles.
4. Full Range of Motion: Ensure a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the bottom and bringing the bar back to chest height.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form and controlled movements.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form. Increase weight in subsequent workouts if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
